announcements.text:
Please BRING a 2B pencil to the final exam.

Final Exam: Thursday 4 December at 9.00 - 12.00 at Building 11 Room s603 and s604. (Same room as our midterm exam)

The exam will be divided into 2 parts:

Multiple-choice questions (Need a 2B pencil to fill in an answer sheet.)
Short-answer questions
It is a closed book exam. The exam content will be from Lecture 9 - 14. There will be NO questions related to Java Spring Boot.
Tomorrow at 16.00 hrs, I will post a Google Sheet link for you to choose a time slot for this Friday project presentation.

I have uploaded videos from our class today to the same Video folder. 

There is no homework for this week's security testing lecture. However, you will have to  do SAST and DAST for the class project.
The OWASP Top Ten 2025 is newly released in the past couple hours! Let's check it out today.

link.title: OWASP Top Ten Web Application Security Risks | OWASP Foundation

announcements.text: Gmail-Linked Credentials Exposed in Massive Breach

For anyone whose IntelliJ cannot find org.springframework.context, try using this dependency instead:
```xml
<dependency>
<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
 <artifactId>spring-boot-starter</artifactId>
 <version>3.5.6</version> <!-- or the latest released Spring Boot version --> 
 </dependency>
```

Reminder: we will have our class this Friday. It'll be a hybrid class. There will be both onsite and online class. For those who will attend an online class, please click the "Join" button in this classroom page.

Please install Java + IDE before this Friday class.

Due to commencement rehearsals this week, there will be no class this Friday. However, since the commencement ends next Thursday, we will have our class next Friday. I will make it a hybrid class next Friday just in case.

After midterm exam, we will be learning secure software development through Java Spring Boot and Spring Security. To prepare, you will need to do the followings.
1. Install Java. You can either install Java 21 or Java 25. (I am still on 21.)
2. Install IDE. There are two options.
        - Option 1: Install IntelliJ (https://www.jetbrains.com/idea/). As a student, you can get the Ultimate version for free. (https://www.jetbrains.com/academy/student-pack/).
        - Option 2: Use any IDEs of your choice, but you need to install Maven (https://maven.apache.org/). Download, unarchive, and set path to maven bin folder.

Midterm Exam: Friday 26 Sept at 9.00 - 12.00 at Building 11 Room s603 and s604.

The exam will be divided into 2 parts:
Multiple-choice questions (to fill in an answer sheet.)
Short-answer questions
It is a  exam. You are not allowed to bring any class materials to the exam. The exam content will be from Lecture 1 - 7. There will be questions related to the  that you've learned via  as well. 

Again, please bring and notice the exam building will be Building 11, not our usual Computer Engineering Building.

courseWork.title: Assignment 6: Frontend and OAuth
courseWork.description:
Finish the frontend integration and Google OAuth (lab 8 - 9). Also add the following.
Add role to UserInfoResponse, so that the frontend can generate different menus for users and admins.
Add a page with a form for creating a new Restaurant.
Submit your code here via GitHub link or .zip files.

courseWork.title: Assignment 5: Secure API
courseWork.description:
Follow lab 2 - 5 before Friday. Also add following exception handlers and logs to improve code and security.
Change the catch clauses in the JwtUtil, JwtAuthFilterl class to use exception handlers in the GlobalExceptionHandler class as well.
Add logs for access control (authorization) - here, we need to log the roles of the person who is signing in.
(Optional) Refactor the AuthenticationController and UserService class to throw the name EntityExistsException when trying to create a user with an existing username. It will make our code cleaner.
Submit your code here via GitHub link or .zip files.

Assignment 2: Self Study: Threat Modeling by Microsoft
courseWork.description:
Let’s learn the threat modeling concept in details via Microsoft learning path. Please go to this website:



https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/paths/tm-threat-modeling-fundamentals/



This is a Microsoft learning path that guides you through the four main phases of threat modeling. There are 7 modules in this learning path. Please go through all 7 modules (as follows) and answer all questions in the modules. 


Introduction to threat modeling
Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
Provide context with the right depth layer
Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
Use a framework to identify threats and find ways to reduce or eliminate risk
Prioritize your issues and apply security controls
Use recommended tools to create a data-flow diagram


To submit this assignment, please capture screen showing your email and the XP you've received after completing the modules (similar to the attached file.)

link.title: Threat Modeling Security Fundamentals - Training | Microsoft Learn
